pr_title: Allow to set a custom route for gRPC service

timeline.message:
Allow to set a custom route for gRPC service

Motivation:

When users want to serve unframed gRPC service, sometimes they might want to use RESTful URL for the endpoint.
A gRPC service path is not a directory which is not divided by `/`.
It is the same as package name such as "/api.v1.service.UserService/GetUsers".
It is not natual for REST client. "/api/v1/service/users/GetUsers" would be better for security control or logging.

See #3072 for more details.

Modifications:

- Add `addService(path, GrpcService)` to `GrpcServiceBuilder`
- Make HandlerRegistry.services() return pairs of route path and `ServerServiceDefinition`.

Result:

- You can now bind a gRPC service to a custom route path.
- Fixes #3072

replies.bodyText: Yeah it's an interesting point. But since MethodDescriptor is type safe, it seems both nice and direct as well as less chance of bugs, and I guess less cognitive load? It's not intuitive to me what sort of system we'd provide for renaming without thinking more deeply, so maybe the end result also won't be able intuitive. Not sure though.
